abstract.p: Steve Harrist and Frank Richardson, Levinas and hermeneutics on ethics and the Other. Theory & Psychology, 22(3), 342–358. DOI: 10.1177/0959354310389647

body.p: The authors of the article “Levinas and hermeneutics on ethics and the Other” in Theory & Psychology, Volume 22(3), pp. 351-352, would like to correct an error. They misquoted a word in a passage by Gantt (1996, p. 135). The word “conventional” should have been “covenential” as in “covenential relationship”, which means Gantt was conveying a richer point than we indicated. The authors regret this error and apologize for any resulting misunderstanding. The correct quote from Gantt is: “…whereas captivity to others is not experienced as captivity at all, but as a covenential relationship that leads to liberation from hedonistic self addiction.”
